Detailed Description

Output events stream: Util::OEventStream.

This class implement a trace buffer mechanism. It inherits from:

  • a buffer to be used for trace
  • a buffer management class (inherited). The flushing of a buffer is done by a buffer manager which manages the buffer allocation and saving on disk.
  • the binder to get the current trace buffer associated to a thread(inherited)
  • the clock and time representation to be used to timestamp event record A generic recorder is associated with a portable level thread (Util::ThId) and is also identified by an integer identifier.

void Util::OEventStream::open ( EventBufferManager *  ebm,
ContextId  cid 
)

open an event stream The event stream may by tied to a thread by using attach(thread). If thread is 0, the newly opened stream is attached to the current thread of execution.

Parameters:
ebm is the event buffer manager to use for allocating memory
thread is the attached thread
